page.title: 01GEOGRAPHY OF THE AREA
page.content:
202 metres at Hutton Bank marks the highest point of our area. The land is highest to the Southwest at Parson's Park Wood (186m), and falls away to the Northeast at 130m.
The course of the Old Petteril river runs through the Southeastern sector of the area, with most other becks feeding into the River Petteril, running North-South to the East of our area.
The landscape is of pleasing aspect, being by and large made up of well tended pasture or arable land, broken with small plantations and larger woods comprising both coniferous and deciduous trees.
We agree, a pleasant place to live!
